sheet_title: 2022 CalGreen AIA Checklist — Residential Mandatory Measures, Sheet 2
description: Second sheet of the 2022 California Green Building Standards Code residential mandatory measures checklist (July 2024 Supplement). Continues from Sheet 1, covering pollutant control VOC tables (adhesives, sealants, formaldehyde), resilient flooring, composite wood products, interior moisture control (vapor retarder, capillary break), indoor air quality and exhaust, environmental comfort (MERV filtration), and Chapter 7 installer/special inspector qualifications and verifications.
key_content: 2022 CalGreen Residential Mandatory Measures Sheet 2 (July 2024 Supplement)
TABLE 4.504.2-1: Adhesive VOC limits — indoor carpet 50 g/L, wood flooring 100 g/L, PVC welding 510 g/L, contact adhesive 80 g/L, multipurpose construction 70 g/L
TABLE 4.504.2: Sealant VOC limits — sealants 250 g/L, sealant primers architectural 250 g/L, sealant primers porous 775 g/L
TABLE 4.504.3: Formaldehyde limits for composite wood products — CARB ATCM and EPA TSCA Title VI compliance
Section 4.504.4: Composite wood products — no added formaldehyde or ULEF resins
Section 4.504.5: Resilient flooring — at least 80% of floor area must comply with VOC emission limits
Section 4.505.2: Concrete slab foundations require 15-mil vapor retarder
Section 4.505.3: Capillary break — 4 inches of 1/2 inch or larger clean aggregate under vapor retarder
Section 4.506: Indoor air quality and exhaust — bathroom exhaust fans ENERGY STAR rated
Section 4.507: Environmental comfort — HVAC air filtration MERV rating requirements
Chapter 7 Section 702: Installer and special inspector qualifications — insulation, weatherization, building envelope
Section 702.2: Special inspection (HCDI) — manufacturing quality assurance, window/door installation inspection
Section 703: Verifications — code compliance verification methods, final inspection and documentation
APPROVED by Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check
